summary: While on a desert excursion, a family encounters cultists who use human hands as sacrificial offerings to their god.

reviews.content: He killed him with a rusty tailpipe. $175000 in 2023 money put to good use.

If it wasn't for MST3K, I wouldn't have seen Manos: The Hands of Fate. I knew I had to see it to see if it really was that bad. The negative criticisms and those slamming it as the worst movie ever do not lie, Manos: The Hands of Fate is as bad as all that. There is such thing as a terrible movie that has novelty comic value, but there is also such thing as a movie that is too inept to take that into consideration. Some will disagree, but I consider Manos: The Hands of Fate as a good example of the latter. To call the way the movie is made amateurish is being too kind, the camera work and editing are all over the place and makes anything that happens incomprehensible. The visual effects are dated and make everything even more artificial than it already is, while the bizarre and often out of sync sound effects and a score that is shrill and monotonous are enough to make your ears bleed. And even when your poor ears are suffering enough, they are assaulted even more by dialogue that is stilted, insultingly cheesy and too talky and some of the worst and annoying acting ever in film history. The villain is quite possibly the most laughable and underwhelming villain ever and you'd be hard pressed to find one that is worse-acted than here. Torga is the best thing about Manos: The Hands of Fate, but that's saying nothing as he's still irritating. The direction is so flat that you have to look hard to find evidence of any direction at all, while the story is incredibly thin and is so plodding that you're dying of boredom. In conclusion, hopelessly inept. 0/10 Bethany Cox
Best movie I ever did see.  Your life is incomplete without it.

Absolute fascinating existence. Torgo is so entertaining to watch. It's a shame he killed himself later that year, makes his obvious drug use throughout the film a little less funny. Not by any means a good movie though.
I'm giving this top marks simply because of its true cult status. Very few people I know can endure watching this. One to watch with your mates for a laugh.
boring and slow. there is no element about this movie worth praise.

IGNORE THE HALF STAR BECAUSE I ACTUALLY GIVE IT ZERO STARS! One of the worst movies I have ever seen. Everything about this movie is dreadful. The acting is wooden, several scenes are disconnected from the entire plot, etc. This movie is absolute garbage.

As a huge fan of movies that are so bad that they are somehow good, this movie is terrible in the worst possible way. While it may be funny at first, the film becomes frustratingly bad as it lacks even "funny" bad moments. If you are looking for a good bad movie, check out birdemic ... that ones a right laugh
masterpiece, idc what you say
One of the greatest movies of all time. I have never been so scared! It was a real nail bitter, but man Torgo was just so beautiful. Love that guy!
Terrible Movie. Worst movie I have seen. It is like watching a train-wreck. This movie is so bad, but I could not stop watching.
Take away the fun commentary from Joel and the bots, and you're left with a bad B-movie with some unintentionally hilarious scenes.
Well, you know, it's after all is a classic, a bad bad movie, but still a classic. How people can say that Ed Wood is the worst director of all times, if there's Hal Warren?

I could shit all over this for the crappy dubbing, lack of lighting and unbelievably awful editing and shot continuity. I could shit all over it for the crude dialogues and laughable acting. I could - and should - shit all over it for that constant ear-busting, flute-raping noodling of a soundtrack. But what I can't get over is how lame and half-baked and uneventful and moronic and boring the story is. I get it if you don't have the budget or the know-how. The question is, do you have a brain?

Manos: The Hands of Fate is the story of a family who become lost while driving thought the West Texas desert and are menaced by a polygamous cult. It also a strong contender for the title of worst movie ever made. With glacial pacing, a threadbare plot, very little that could be described as acting, no real production values to speak of, and nothing remotely scary or exciting, it's a near perfect example of how not to make a movie.

This makes a lot a lot of sense once you know the story behind the movie. You see, Manos was written, directed, and produced by an El Paso insurance salesman with no experience in film or acting, in order to win a bet that he could make a movie. He did this with a near zero budget, a cast of community theater volunteers and random townspeople, and the absolute minimum of editing and post-production work possible. He won his bet, but seeing the result, you'll seriously wonder if it was worth it. 

At least the first five minutes consist of the family driving aimlessly around the desert, passing the same amorous teenage couple again and again, in what may be the most pointless, meandering opening sequence ever put on film. Apparently, this was supposed to be a leisurely opening credits sequence, but the filmmakers ran out of money to add the credits, and just left it in to pad the runtime. It drags on and on, going nowhere, adding nothing to the story, until they finally reach the Master's house. Sadly, this brings very little improvement in plot or pacing.

Instead we're mainly treated to slow, awkward conversations, aborted attempts to leave the Master's house for somewhere safer, and even more shots of that teen couple making out in their car. The closest thing this movie has to a high point is the extended catfight between the Master's nightgown clad wives, but even this gets boring after the first couple minutes. You know you're in trouble when you can't make gratuitous exploitation work.

As with any bad horror movie, the characters spend far too much time wandering around looking for each other, calling out each other's names over and over with no reply. You wouldn't think it would take them so long to find each other in such a small house in the absolute middle of nowhere. Then again, it is pretty dark, and these people aren't very bright. 

 Now the reason it's so dark is that in order to accommodate the cast and crew's day jobs, most shooting was done at night. Only they didn't have the budget for proper lighting, so most of the exterior scenes are pitch black. Hence the scene in which police hear gunshots, walk a few steps from their car to investigate, then turn around and give up because it's too dark to see anything. The lack of production values is even more apparent when one of the night scenes cuts to a piece of stock footage- instantly recognizable as such because it's better lit and photographed than any other part of the movie.

If there is any redeeming value to this production beyond sheer camp, it's John Reynold's one of a kind performance as Torgo, the Master's slow talking, long suffering henchman and housekeeper. I'm not saying it's a good performance. In fact, it's about as far from anything resembling a good performance as can be imagined. But between his stilted, halting speech, jerking movements, and near constant facial tics, Reynold's acting is so awful, so creepy, in such a uniquely bizarre way, that it's almost hypnotic. Like a Beatnik version of Nic Cage, he's either manic or semi-comatose in every scene. No one could possibly be this terrible on purpose, and I was not at all surprised to learn that he was in fact a heavy drug user.

The other performances are also uniformly bad, but aside from a few amusingly overwrought outbursts from the Master, only in the flat, boring manner of the entire movie. It's kind of amazing that it takes over ninety minutes for so little to happen, or that what's supposed to be a horror movie can be so utterly devoid of anything remotely scary. It does manage to be intermittently creepy, but only in all the wrong ways, as in the deeply unwholesome final scene, which I can only hope the filmmakers didn't realize the full undertones of.

The whole thing is just an utter mess of earnest intentions colliding with woeful ineptitude, like Ed Wood minus the minor celebrities and special effects. It's slow, boring, disjointed, frequently bizarre, and completely botched on every imaginable level. If there is a lesson to this movie, it's that just because you can do something, it doesn't mean you should. I cannot recommend the original cut, even to the most committed bad movie lovers. However, I can recommend the Mystery Science Theater 3000 treatment, which makes for a rather amusing, relatively painless introduction to the cult of Manos.
Again, folks, it sure ain't Repo Man. And thank Manos for that! Crap, but still not residing in the same sewer as Repo Man.
If this were a comedy it would be a masterpiece. Sadly, the horror genre is the polar opposite of the comedy genre.

I've seen this movie 3 times and laughed hard each time I did. The first was on MST3K and the other times with rifftrax. With that said I can't image what it must be like to watch this inept film without a commentary track pointing out how ridiculous it is from a technical and content standpoint. An 8 with MST3K, a 10 with rifftrax and a 0 on its own for an overall 6.
Literally the worst movie ever made in the history of movies. How do you rate a zero? So bad even the MST3K crew couldn't help.
The best part of this movie is the score, which is actually pretty entertaining.
Make better moives people 😡😡😡😡 Don't waste your money on it!
Worst movie I've ever seen, "Watch It Now"?  Once was too many times.
Only gets a 1.5 bc its so bad its funny.   You cant unsee this one.  You'lll never forget it

This movie is truly terrible, the only thing that makes it even slightly bearable to watch is to watch the mystery science theatre 3000 episode about it. It is about an evil man who wears a cloak type think with giant sleeves so when he holds out his arms like a t pose you see two red hand prints hanging down. And they pronounce it not "monos" like you do in spanish but "manos" like you added os to the word man

Don’t do this to yourself. You deserve better. Everyone does, even people I hate deserve better! To tell you how awful the film is, it starts out by driving through the countryside for several minutes with no dialogue while the opening credits are supposed to be scrolling past. Except there ARE no opening credits because they never put them in! The film proceeds to go downhill from there.

It was like a train wreck I couldn't look away from. I was only able to get through it because of the MST3K guys. Without them I would have died of boredom, horror, and disgust within the first half hour.

Manos: The Hands of Fate is a horror movie about a young family being trapped in a lodge in the desert, while its owner summons the evil demon Manos. Conventional criteria of quality can't really be used for describing the movie's features, as there are countless apparent flaws in the production, e.g., the plot, the acting quality, and the editing. However, in a way, all these problematic technical aspects sum up to a fascinating experience that doesn't bears any resemblance to what most come to expect from movies in general. Therefore, it can be watched for escapist entertainment, mocking the low quality or even for technical analyses. Ultimately, as a movie, Manos: The Hands of Fate, can only be recommended as a prime example of what not to do.
Full review: https://movie-discourse.blogspot.com/2018/11/manos-hands-of-fate-usa-1966.html?view=flipcard

Manos: The Hands of Fate is the worst film I've ever seen in my life. While many other films make me angrier and are more offensive, Manos is just ineptly made in every sense of the word.

0/10
Terrible. Hilarious.

Not the worst film ever made (there is one worse, I'll get to that later), Manos: The Hands of Fate is definitely ONE of the worst films ever made. Terrible camerawork, dubbing, laughable dialogue, and lots of filler, Manos is a film you have to see to understand, so I can't say anything more, but just watch the film, its an experience for sure.

This movie has changed my life. Never before has a film stirred such raw passion in me before. The gut-wrenching horror, the beautiful acting and original score. Warren's dedication to this film's success to the point of attempting to sell out his lead actress. You name it, this movie is a work of pure love and a credit to film.
I have never been more inspired to make a movie until I saw this.
So awful, but extremely funny!

If you want to watch a piece of crap from the bowels of hell, well this is the movie for you, the acting is unintentionally hilarious, the music is actually annoying and the movie is so boring that you want turn the damn thing off! If you want to watch this movie I recommend the MST3K or Rifftrax versions. At least those versions make this schlock-fest tolerable. Avoid this flick.

Manos: The Hands of Fate, translating to Hands: The Hands of Fate is quit possibly one of the stupidest movies I have ever seen.  It fails on every level, with terrible voice dubbing, random scenes that make no sense, and the worst cinematography I have ever seen as the camera is often out of focus, Manos is a terrible movie.  It is so bad that it is just bad.
forget troll 2, at least that had entertainment value, this has none. it's boring, poorly acted and all the characters are idiots. ladies and gents the worst horror movie of all time.
Manos: The Hands Of Shit Overall Grade: F (0/10)

Its horrible, but I love it. There's something oddly inspirational about Manos. A farmer was dared to make a movie and he did it. You can tell this was a labor of love even if it makes Ed Wood look like Francis Coppola.

Okay, so this movie is bad.  We can all agree on that.  Instead of telling you why, let me make the case for a reboot of this film and how it should go.

1. The remake needs to be over-budget and directed by Michael Bay.  It must have gratuitous special effects that add nothing to the plot nor the overall believability of the film.  In fact, a failure to suspend of disbelief is a requirement just like the original.
2. The dialog from Hal Warren's screenplay cannot be changed under any circumstances.
3. The original failed to make the beginning of the film as boring as it really could have been.  The landscape must not match any recognizable region of the US or Europe, and must nonsensically transition from temperate to desert in order to isolate the rule of isolation that should be the main theme of this film.
4. Because a reboot of this film would be set in the 21st Century, no cell phone nor satellite service is a must. However, whoever remakes this film should fail to capitalize on this and any other themes including seclusion, isolation, or loneliness.  As tempting as it would be to any sensible person to explore the loneliness of Torgo's character, this easy opening to develop character needs to be avoided as it was in the original.
5. Characters:
Michael has to be an idiot without being idiotic, he has to be condescending without emoting condescension, and he was to be unsurprisingly average without seeming to be overtly average nor inept.  A younger Kevon Costner-type should have play this role.

The actress who plays Margaret should be billed as beautiful, but only has not look unattractive. Her character does not have to exude sexiness nor does it have to attract.  Her job in the original and the remake is to be feminine.  When Torgo hits on her awkwardly, she should not emote any reaction whatsoever except to eventually catch on that Torgo is making a pass at her.  In fact, the less cerebral this scene is made, the better.

The child or dog can be any random child or dog-looking animal who can take simple direction (sit, stand, say something...).  In fact, all they have to do is to fit the "lost thing" paradigm and there has to be some amount of sympathy for their having been lost or killed.  These two roles can be played by any animal-like organism that would elicit some sense of loss of they were no longer there. The Second Unit production crew can handle filming their parts.  As such, there's no need to cast anyone known for these two parts; the film's money should be wasted elsewhere.

The Master needs NOT to be played by a washed-up actor looking to rehabilitate their acting career -- any interesting backstory within the film or beyond the fourth wall would make the role and the film too compelling and interesting.  In fact, the actor who plays the role of the really evil Master needs to be less interesting in person than they appear in the painting Michael and Margaret encounter shortly after entering the dwelling.

In an era or Political Correctness, Torgo cannot be handicapped.  That's not a bad thing because any handicap would make a case for a meaningful backstory.  Torgo has to be just odd and just odd should suffice.  Any more than that would make would diminish his meager backstory (the only meaningful backstory in the original film) of being infatuated with the Master's wives.  That is the driver of this film:  not the sense of isolation, not what made him have intensely swollen and misshapen legs, not the fact that he strange accent which might make it interesting if we found out he was was somewhere else, or event the fact that he carries a staff.  Its my belief that Torgo is should really treated Radagast from the "Lord of the Rings" books and not the fully-developed version Peter Jackson developed in "The Hobbit."  Just some guy in brown (or khaki) with a hat and a staff who bathes infrequently and isn't from around those parts.  That's being generous and maybe too much so.

Megan Fox needs to chick who makes out with the guy who gets caught like 2 or 3 times by the police.  The officer should be Sting because his English accent makes the "small-town cop" vibe more believable if you are on intense medications and because I think Sting should do more small-bit parts in more meaningless films.  

Mark Wahlberg should be NOT be the dude making out with her and ANY song by Marky-Mark and the Funky Bunch SHOULD NOT be playing on the radio whilst kissing and drinking Robitussin cough syrup is done hedonistically yet without abandon.  The Hedonistic-without-Abandon is a MUST, Megan Fox is a must, and the dude should be one of the lesser-known Baldwin Brothers trying to pass himself off as being 20 years younger and yet serious.

Yep.  That about sums it up.

This was a very bad movie on so many levels.  The audio was not one of them.  Thanks to its mediocre sound effects I am compelled to give it a whole star.  Honestly, for a completely amateur movie made as a bet on a $19,000 budget, this wasn't that bad.  All that said, this movie is not worth the watch and the single star is mostly out of pity.
This movie sucks...but I LOVE IT!!!!
Only watch the MST3K version
It was terrible, but in a good way. I laughed the whole time, and I had a great time!??
If it were possible to give this movie a negative rating, I would gladly do so....
An aggressively boring film with poor sound, horrible acting, bad dialogue and sluggish pacing. Thank God for Mystery Science Theater.
Probably one of the worst movies ever. It made a good Mystery Science Theater 3000 episode though.

Decided to watch one of Mystery Science Theater 3000 episodes on Netflix. They ran this movie called Manos: The Hands of Fate. My god, it's one of the worst movies I've ever seen. It was so unbearable and painful to watch that my eyes actually bled.
What can be said about this nonsense.  Bad everything.

I would love a choice of ZERO star for this. they say its the worst film in the world and boy they are not lying lol. it was painfully and watching it through MST-3K made it just bearable cos there no way I could make it through unfiltered.  bloody dreadful, not even worthy of so-bad-it-so-good list.
Horrifically slow and nonsensical, it's hardly even so bad that it's good.
Awful, just Awful. Worst movie I have ever seen. Would recommend. Everyone should experience this.

One of the BEST WORST films ever! The plot really makes no sense, the acting is bad, editing is atrocious, and the camerawork is bleh! However the involuntary comedy makes this an enjoyable, especially if your watching the MST3K version! And of course TORGO!!

It's times like this when the famous phrase from AVGN, which is "a shit load of fuck" is very appropriate. I mean, what has humanity come to, how could we have let shit like this to be made. It's awful, it's disgusting. Everything in this pic is an utter failure, the dialogue is barely audible, the screenplay is shit, the story makes no sense and the acting is awful, there ain't a single line of dialogue in this movie that doesn't sound fake. I pity MST3K for having to watch this shit stain. It makes Zombie Apocalypse (2011) and The Giant Spider Invasion (1977), mashed up together, look like Citizen Kane. And y'all know what's even worse? There's, apparently, going to be a sequel in production, called "Manos Return", but in the name of shitty shit, is it really necessary, no it ain't. Not recommended at all.

I'll never understand why people like Plan 9 but hate Manos. This film was justly shunned in its day as a horror film, but unjustly ignored as accidental comedy even then. The lore surrounding this film is also of note: suicidal actors, striking camera crews, over-dubbing every single line, etc. The accidental visual comedy never relents in this absurdly conceived and misunderstood classic of bad cinema.

This is a bad but harmless movie, made by committed people with little resources who tried their best.  There are lots of enjoyable directing and technical errors.  There are also unintentionally awkward moments in which the characters stare at each other to create a dramatic effect but end up looking like they don't know what to do.

Disclaimer: I watched this movie through Mystery Science Theater.  However, out of all the movies MST has used, Manos was by far the most boring.  There were some ideas and scenes that could have been quite entertaining, but the execution of said ideas was very lacking.  From the acting to the cinematography, this movie was not done well at all.
Another difficult-to-rate one. By all standards of filmmaking, it's one of the most apocalyptically inept films ever made. But it's still a ton of fun to watch.

The star rating reflects the MST3K viewing, not the original product, because let's not kid ourselves, right

Rental.
Does this even count as a film? It just literally pointless video clips mashed together, and it's only an hour long like the la chatte et le sexe movie.
It only gets this high of a rating because of the amazing MST3K treatment that this film got... Otherwise, I would have rated it MUCH lower (even if I can't go much lower)
"Manos Hands of Fate" looks like it was made by a non professional film maker. Despite this, it was very enjoyable to watch and it had some great unintentional comedy.
If you know what a bad movie is, you HAVE to see this! Otherwise, you don't know
Quite deservedly one of the worst movies ever.

Never in my life have I seen something that's so freaking bad like Manos: The Hands of Fate.

Terrible acting, awful editing where you'll clearly see the actors keep looking at the camera waiting for "cut" and sh*tty directing. Overall Manos: The Hands of Fate deserves the title of "Worst movie ever made", because it truly is the worse.

It's just bad and not funny bad or with some kind of historical interest. Just that. Bad and boring. I just gave it 1/2 star because now I use it for a "... ok, but it's not "Manos bad, is it?" kind of rating.

The only reason to watch this movie, is to make another suffer. Even if that other person is yourself. Attempting to analyze this movie is pointless. It can't even be laughed at it's so bad. After you see it, you realize how stupid it was, then you'll make fun of it.

It's awful, plain and simple.
And yet, I find it impossible to look away from. It's become a new favorite of mine.
Yucca Flats was much, much worse.

Probably the worst movie ever made, definitely in the top three. Everything about it is a complete failure. Acting(nonexistent) writing, directing, camera work, it all sucks on a huge level. Nothing works and the whole film is broken. Pure garbage. On the plus side it's absolutely hilarious.
A fun watch with friends and drinks.
Not quite as bad as the legend says but still very bad. I love it.
Only watch with MST3K at your assistance.

One of the worst movies ever. No opening credits save the title, unintelligible, muffled dialogue due to poor sound, and dear God, this movie is boring. What good is a cult with only a handful of people in the middle of nowhere? What's with the two lovers that never actually do anything? What happened to Torgo?

Don't be confused by my rating: The writing is awful, the plot never really gets going and the film print itself is nearly burnt to a crisp. But for whatever reason, it almost works. The fact that the film was shot on a cheap home movie camera circa 1966 gives the film a creepy home movie vibe, especially when combined with the fact nothing happens within the first five minutes, it almost makes you feel like you're watching a real life home movie that went horribly array. The guy that plays Torgo is also excellent. Allegedly he was high on LSD throughout the entire thing and his shaking and lurching adds to the atmosphere. Once the Master comes into the picture it's all over though. Manos is a film that succeeds where it does purely by accident but ultimately is brought down by a boring script.
My opinion of this crappy movie, the master will not approve.
Holy crap, this is a MOVIE?

Why Ed Wood is the worst director of all time if cinema had Harold Warren creator of one of the worst movies ever (and of me the worst film in the world beside Hobogoblins). Manos an indulgent error and a very funny involuntary comedy.
So many things bad about this movie that nothing could turn around and make it good, except for a man and his 2 robot friends.
Well worthy of the title "The worst movie ever"This movie is truly a living nightmare.But the thing that pains me is that it won 't let me give this movie zero stars

So incoherent it's like watching some sort of weird art film, Manos fails on every level except 'so bad it's kind of hilarious'. With a soundtrack that sounds like Frank Zappa does Miles Davis, drunk, and long stretches where nothing happens, this truly is an endurance challenge. Nothing makes sense, the characters are all idiots and the only saving grace, Torgo was played so ineptly that the actor killed himself. It truly is the worst film ever made. I watched the uncut film first, and the MST3K version afterwards, and frankly my advice is if you want to watch this film, watch the MST3K version and save yourself a lot of pain. So dreadful it's almost a religious experience. Poor Torgo.

I believe the power of a great film can be as strong a very bad film, I believe Manos is a very great bad film. a man getting rubed to death, strange dub choices and the only Guy in the film on LSD steals the damn show, what isn't to love? Truly a underrated gem.
The remaining cast and crew can be contacted at the official Manos Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/177384648970155/
Manos Loves Women--A Cult Curiosity!!
One of the worst movies ever, great with commentary from MST3K and Rifftrax though.

Regularly cited as one of the worst films ever made, horrifically incompetent chiller, Manos: The Hands of Fate, is a though-and-through must-see movie, if only to experience its complete cinematic ineptitude.
Abysmal acting, a nonsensical narrative and painful pace issues characterise what is quite simply silver screen suicide; a truly unbelievable picture, watchable solely for the hilarity of its unintentional comedy and sheer ludicrousness. But I guess this is just what happens in 1966 when you give a Texan insurance and fertiliser salesman funding to write, direct and star in his own horror movie. Manos has to be seen to be believed.
So bad it's horrible

Mind-numbingly boring, filled with technical errors, editing flaws, horrible writing, and terrible terrible acting. There are a ton of shots that don't fit in with the plot, characters that we don't care about, and random jump cuts. I can see why it's often cited as one of the worst movies ever made. It's not scary, and it drags on for what seems like hours, but the running time is only 68 minutes! This was just a terrible terrible movie. I wish I coulda spend that hour and eight minutes doing something else.
Might be the best "bad enough to be good" -movie I've seen in years.

Manos: The Hands of Fate is legendarily bad and considered to be the worst horror movie ever made. That's quite an accomplishment considering the horror genre has a killer elevator, a trilogy about a killer cookie, one about a killer bed, and so many other goofy films more viable to take that spot. Yet regardless of being label as "the worst horror movie of all time" it continues to attract audiences and some even end up liking it. How could it be that what's consider trashed by the majority is treasured by many? Underneath the rough surfaces lies something that entertains for the wrong reason few bad films can.

Hands: The Hands of Fate on the spot improv plot is about a family getting lost on the road and stumbling upon a hidden, underground, devil-worshiping cult led by the fearsome Master and his servant Torgo. To be honest the premise could have worked it has an unconventional narrative, is unpredictable, and slowly reveals the answers to it mystery that is setup. Problem with all of these elements being the execution of them. Everything is loosely and flimsily connected by a thin thread. In fact if the character ever left the house the film would have no plot to speak off. With the exception of Torgo secondary characters are useless. A couple too cheap to afford a cheap hotel or go to their parent homes always make out publicly in a car. Easily persuadable policemen who give you a free pass on a speeding ticket if you're late and for some reason making out in public is illegal in this town or desert. Than the six wives of The Master each younger than the last. Unfortunately given the context within the film the couple daughter not being killed could be debated that the Master is a ped...better yet lets avoid that territory altogether. Also I want to meet the person who dubbed this. I'm no expert on the English language, but are you sure "You all are mad. Mad the whole lot of you." is proper English. Characters have no development not even enough to be one dimensional. Each character has one trait (like being hungry) and that's about it. Now no one could talk this film without mentioning the iconic Torgo. This character is the sole reason this film thrives in awfulness. Actor John Reynold non-experience as an actor gives the character a nice touch. His awkward walk from probably smoking one too many joint, goofy facial expression, and silly line delivery adds to a layer of entertainment to his character.

As for the other area the film is a complete failure. For the first half hour the amazement of how every bad decision accumulated into a something so shockingly bad is something difficult to not want to look at. Than the second half becomes a tedious series of repetition slowly loosing its charm. The editing in this film is among the worst anyone could string together. Lines of dialogue repeat loop, awkward cuts that make you question if the copy of the film you're watching is in poor condition, and the improper timing of inserting music. For example, when first meeting Torgo "scary" music plays when Torgo is getting luggage from a car. It seems the clown noise someone was squeaking behind the scenes was kept in the film for some reason. Music in this film sounds like the instruments themselves were laughing. One of the most noticeable of laughing instruments is during the worst catfight ever staged is scored using a laughing Saxophone. Editing just in general is questionable. In one scene a dog goes out into the desert and is killed by what sounds like Ducks. It will leave your jaws open in how bad editing could scoop down to. As for the acting it lives up to its reputation. Actors break the forth wall looking directly in the cameras and monotone performances. Because of the poor editing you could spot clapperboards, actor getting to their location for the scene, and scenes where it's clear the actors themselves are holding the camera. As far as art direction goes it lacking evidently; the only time it chooses to expresses itself beyond limitation is The Master cape having two giant hands on it. Aside from that everything has and retains a low-budget feel.

Hands: Los Manos of Fate lives up to its reputation, but not entirely like how one would expect. It's devoid of any proper craftsmanship yet the cast and crew heart behind it is felt regardless how the quality turned out. There's a reason audiences go seeking this "awful" film and avoid atrocities such as Monster-A-Go-Go. A bad film can entertain it audiences even if how it does that is unintentional as oppose to one that doesn't. Who would wants to dig up a fifty plus year old that will infuriates them. On the surface everybody clearly sees the rough edges, but some that look past that sees an entity that brings a good time like any film attempts to do.
When the people on MS3TK can't make this funny, you know it's bad.
so glad i watched it on mst-3k
This movie, with heckling commentary, made me want to kill myself. That is all.
This film has a wide reputation of the worst film ever made. The people who say that clearly have not seen Monster A Go Go.

I believe that when reviewing films, ratings should take into account aspects such as budget, artistic integrity and experience of the actors and crew involved. Judging Manos is like judging the work of your children. Yes, their drawings may be rough but they are just children.
On that note, Manos is woeful in every aspect of cinematography, acting, editing and engineering. But is it any worse than major Hollywood fodder where they should know better? Probably, but seeping beneath the layers of dubbing, irrelevant scenes and prolonged pauses between dialogue is a memorable and audacious attempt at proving someone wrong. Concept-wise there are elements taken from 50's and 60's horror and the acting by John Reynolds and Tom Neyman simulate and emulate fear within you,
I refuse to believe that this is 'the worst of the worst' and pales in comparison to some other fodder churned out in cinemas since and that it is less enjoyable than Ed Wood films.
Surely it's better to burn out than fade away, the Master would not approve of your distain towards this film.
Don't bother with the original.  Get the MST3K version and enjoy some of their best riffs.

Yes, it's an incompetently made movie, but I can't really criticize Manos all that much, because when a movie has a budget as miniscule as this, you just can't expect it to be much of anything. And as far as little home movies made by nobodies go, this gets the job done. Also, I actually thought the twist ending was pretty good.
the worst of the worst

The MSTK3 version is hilarious. I don't think that I could watch this without that, oh wait I already have and it is entertainingly bad. Torgo and the master, lets just say that I could say something, they are gold. Like the soundtrack though. The master doesn't approve of the critics. I have seen worse.
This was an awesome movie, it had so many adventures scenes and always put me on the tip of my seat. They really made the setting clear of cars, fields and other extremely important stuff
A family on holiday stops at a scary house to ask for direction where the keeper communes with the Devil. One of the most famously horrible films, really dull and not even funny, let alone scary.

Manos: The Hands of Fate is surely joke from before pre-production since it was made by a manure salesman based on a bet he had with a screenwriter about making a horror film, and Hal P. Warren who directed, wrote and acted in it used a hand winding camera that has visual quality no more than antique and can only film 30 seconds of footage at a time, so combined with the terrible audio quality and the senseless series of car shots in the intro and the constant flickering sound in the background and the sight of a clapperboard in frame or moths being attracted to the lighting and getting in way of the terrible film before the viewer's eyes solidifies the legacy Manos: The Hands of Fate has for being one of the most poorly crafted films in existence.
Unfortunately, Manos: The Hands of Fate is too boring to be entertaining by its badness due to the way it features two pointless plot lines and never locks its attentions on one or lights them well enough to be seen and gains the benefit of having the most terrible boring catfight in film history. 
And the sight of unknown actors and a young girl dubbed in post production by an old woman is so strange, especially since the potentially LSD addicted John Reynolds is shaking so much throughout the film and forced to stutter physically and talk while the sound has been cut out so essentially it's a man intended to be a satyr suffering from what looks like Parkinson's disease but is actually just crappy direction from Hal P. Warren. 
Essentially, like many other films of the worst of all time genre, the plot just doesn't make the slightest bit of sense and is only of relevance to the word Manos through strange and terrible scriptwriting. Essentially, the characters embody no cult, massage each other to death and the entire film had some unspecified role in contributing to the suicide of lead actor John Reynolds, and the mystery surrounding that is one of the pieces of the films legacy.
I didn't particularly hate Manos: The Hands of Fate, but there's nothing to like and it isn't even worth watching just for the stupidity. But at least Hal P. Warren won his bet and got to live out his life as a manure salesman with the pride of winning a bet against an Oscar-winning screenwriter.
Every bit as bad as its reputation suggests, this is undoubtedly the worst film I've ever seen.

Not all that bad considering how incredibly limited the production of this movie was. It's a dark and spooky horror movie with both an unconventional structure and  an unpredictable story. Throw in some of the most memorable characters of all time and a super cool free-jazz soundtrack and you've got yourself a recipe for a solidly entertaining, if not well executed, movie.
The MST3K version is pretty hilarious. The movie itself is awful to the very last frame.
Come on already - some movies are so bad that they are fun to watch and this is one of them

This movie is by far one of the worst movies I've ever seen; why exactly? Because of wooden acting, so many errors (flies bumping into the camera, clapboards seen, people looking at the cameras, etc.), horrible plot which involves padding, awful editing and also, the infamous driving scene that goes on for at least 9-10 minutes and the characters hardly do anything.
A HORRIBLE display of what a movie is... utterly embarrassing and inane; one of the worst films ever made and an utter joke to the movie industry.
As bad as it is, it's one of my favorite bad movies.

While it may not be the funniest of the 'National Lampoon's Vacation" series, the concept of Clark W. Griswald giving his soul to the devil is not exactly the worst idea I've ev---what? It's NOT part of the 'Vacation' film series? Oh, never mind then. The film is terrible.
So bad, I got eye, ear and head ache from it.
WORST MOVIE OF ALL TIME

LOVE IT!!!!! My God, it is so awful! You have to see it! A cult classic that will blow your socks off with its terrible acting, editing, directing, script, and anything that makes a decent flick. Must watch with the MST3K commentary. Without that you'll want blow your brains out. If you don't watch the mst3k version, just grab a couple buddies and enjoy. You'll thank me later.
It's bad. Very bad. The worst. Do not watch.
Yes, it's bad, but, I still think I've seen worse. Turkish star wars anyone??
So terrible, so legendary. Not even MST3K could make it funny. I'd totally kill to have The Master's robe though.

A movie that ACTUALLY makes "Jaws: The Revenge" look like a masterpiece. If it wasn't for The MST3K Crew, I would have never had got through it. (1/10)

Holy shit, this was bad! I watched this film without MST3K commentary and I can definitely say that this film has earned the reputation it has. While it isn't the worst film I've ever seen, it's still a horrible excuse for a film that does a bad job in every aspect of film-making. The story is confusing and poorly written the acting is bad, the dubbing is awful, the dialogue is horrible (How many fucking times do you need to say, "Mike, I'm scared!" anyway?), the editing is atrocious, it's confusing to follow due to poor storytelling and editing, and it's also horribly boring. That's what really kills Manos, though, because boredom is the ultimate kiss of death on any film. Despite being a little over an hour, it's horribly tedious and moves slow as ass. I actually began to doze off because it was so fucking boring and slow, with only a few moments of camp value to extract from this miserable experience. Don't watch this film unless you are a hardened B-movie fanatic, otherwise you will not survive it, especially without MST3K commentary. However, in some ways, I am glad such a horrible thing exists because it is a valuable film in the history of cinema, though not for good reasons.

This movie is SOOOO bad. When my friends and I are trying to figure out how bad a movie is we ask "Is it Manos bad?", because basically this movie is as bad as you can get and if something surpassed it then I must watch it immediately. If you really want to feel bad, read the story of the people who invested in this movie and what happened to some of the actors. Truly heartbreaking. It is as tragic as everything in this movie.
